summary:
I have been practicing synthetic chemistry from 14-years including 7+ years of industrial experience with excellent problem-solving ability and project leadership skills. Specialized in synthesis of small-molecules, ,natural products, novel API impurities, metabolites, isotopically labeled drugs, and reference standards.
Synthesized peptide linkers for ADCs, as well as biotinylated compounds, nucleotides, nucleosides, RNA phosphoramidites, and potential KINASE inhibitors. 
Enhanced Process Development Proficiency: Expertise in Route Exploration, Method Upscaling to Kilogram Levels, Rigorous Process Hazard Analysis, and Secure Handling of High-Potency (HP) Compounds.
Strong expertise in separation techiniques, developed methods for separating complex mixtures using advanced purification techniques such as ion-exchange chromatography, reverse-phase chromatography, and automated column chromatography.
Highly skilled in elucidating structure of small to complex organic compounds by using analytical and spectroscopic techniques i.e. 1D and 2D NMR, HPLC, UPLC, GCMS, LCMS, HRMS, IR, UV-vis, and chromatography.
headline: Senior synthetic chemist - Level 1

Formal Synthesis of (+)-Lasubine II and (−)-Subcosine II via Organocatalytic Michael Addition of a Ketone to an α-Nitrostyrene

publications.description: Cyclic phosphonium anhydrides generated from bis-phosphine oxides and trifluoromethanesulfonic anhydride are shown as general coupling reagents in a dehydrative glycosylation reaction of C1-hemiacetals. This reaction protocol is characterized by a broad substrate scope and high yields, including reactions of O-, C-, N-, and S-based nucleophiles with furanose, pyranose, and deoxysugar donors.
publications.name: Dehydrative glycosylation with cyclic phosphonium anhydrides

ingestedContentSummary.description: We use plastic tubs for everything from taking our sandwiches to work to storing food in the freezer and reheating leftovers in the microwave. But are they safe and should we be looking for alternatives?
ingestedContentSummary.title: Are plastic storage containers safe for food?

message.text:
Concerned about the safety of using plastic food storage containers? 🍲 Learn more about the potential risks from chemicals in household #FoodContactMaterials in this insightful BBC article. 

> Among the issues it discusses are non-intentionally added substances: including chemicals that change during plastic manufacturing, then migrate into food and drinks, and into our bodies.

> It’s also known that acidic or fatty foods like tomato sauce or lasagne can absorb more chemicals from plastic containers than others – while hot foods also help transfer more chemicals than cold.

LGC Standards provides over 950 #ReferenceMaterials and #ResearchChemicals to support studies into Food Contact Materials – including bisphenols, photoinitiators, phthalates, and PFAS. Find out more: https://okt.to/dw1Kxp

#ScienceForASaferWorld #FoodSafety

💊Scientists may have moved closer to the full industrial synthesis of #paclitaxel – which could lead to better supplies of the leading #CancerDrug.

> Because of its complex molecular structure, paclitaxel can only be made semi-synthetically at present, which means that production is limited by the availability of slow-growing natural materials. (Learn more in LGC Mikromol™'s #PharmaRoots article: https://okt.to/pAHySo) 

> The global market for paclitaxel products is expected to be worth $20 billion by 2025, but the lack of a fully synthetic route means that manufacturers cannot fully meet growing demand.

> However, a new study has successfully identified key missing enzymes in paclitaxel’s biosynthetic pathway – potentially laying the foundation for large scale production. Read the study at https://okt.to/KoVCOh

🔬 LGC Standards meanwhile provides a range of high quality research chemicals and reference materials to support your laboratory’s paclitaxel analysis: https://okt.to/DMFBzK

#pharma #PharmaceuticalAnalysis

ingestedContentSummary.description: The FDA approved 55 new drugs in 2023 - almost 50% more than the previous year. In this article, we reflect on the key developments in drug approval during 2023, and also predict the potential trends and pivotal events to anticipate in 2024
ingestedContentSummary.title: Novel Therapies Approvals by FDA | LGC Standards

message.text:
Discover the latest advancements in drug approvals by the FDA in 2023 by checking out our latest blog post 🔗https://okt.to/RFc98f

💡 The blog also previews some of the key drugs that are expected to be approved in 2024 – including an Alzheimer’s targeting monoclonal antibody and an MDMA treatment for PTSD.

✅ Getting up to speed on the latest therapeutic developments – from AKT inhibitors to Alzheimer’s disease, and oncology to orphan drugs – has never been so easy!
